au.edu.ausstage.utils
Class GoogleChartManager

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.ausstage.utils.GoogleChartManager

public class GoogleChartManager
extends java.lang.Object

A class to help in the construction of URLs for use with the Google Chart API. Note this is not intended to be a replacement for existing libraries or for the more advanced features. It is to help with the creation of simple charts only.

Method Detail

simpleEncode

public static java.lang.String simpleEncode(java.lang.String[] values,
                                            int maxValue)
A method to encode an array of values using the simple encoding method as specified by the Google Chart API Based on the code found here: http://code.google.com/apis/chart/docs/data_formats.html#encoding_data

Parameters:
values - an array of string values to encode
maxValue - the maximum value in the dataset
Returns:
a string containing the encoded data

buildBarChart

public static java.lang.String buildBarChart(java.lang.String width,
                                             java.lang.String height,
                                             java.lang.String data,
                                             java.lang.String title,
                                             java.lang.String yMax,
                                             java.lang.String[] xLabels)
A method to build a bar chart

Parameters:
title - the chart title
xLabels - an array of labels to use for the x axis
yMax - the maximum y value
data - the data to build the chart with
width - the width of the chart image
height - the height of the chart image
Returns:
the URL for the bar chart

buildBarChart

                                             java.lang.String height,
                                             java.lang.String data,
                                             java.lang.String title,
                                             java.lang.String yMax)
A method to build a bar chart, the x axis labels will be calculated automatically

Parameters:
title - the chart title
yMax - the maximum y value
data - the data to build the chart with
width - the width of the chart image
height - the height of the chart image
Returns:
the URL for the bar chart
